title: Ticket #5643: Python ClassAd parser fails on streams
description:
The new python ClassAd parsing code currently rewinds the stream in two places:
  1. To auto-detect whether the old classad or new classad parser should be used (hm - we should probably parse XML too at some point!).
  2. To reset the file pointer at the end of the ad. This simplifies the interaction with buffering of file streams.

So, right now a irreversible stream (such as with a Unix pipe) will cause an exception. However, we can proceed as long as the user specifies the parser to use.
remarks:
2016-Apr-20 07:57:32 by tim:
This ticket is a duplicate of #5274

2016-Apr-20 08:12:49 by bbockelm:
Ah! I thought that this had been filed before -- I just couldn't find it with the gittrac search functionality.

In fact, would be possible to get a 'python bindings' subsystem? That would make aggregating these tickets easier.

Anyhow, fix is pushed to the branch as well as a unittest.

2016-Apr-29 13:52:31 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Thank you for finally fixing this. It looks fine. Now on to fix the example in the manual.
